ygData.subject: Re: Play Time?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... It s a lot easier after your first one, especially if you decide to twink.  You can twink, you know what to fight, you have powerful friends, and if you
ygData.messageBody:
On Wed, 26 Jan 2000, David Nolle wrote:
>
> Alright, I've been reading this list for a long time and been playing EQ
> since about three weeks after release. It simply blows my mind that anyone
> could have a 50th Level character, let alone more than one! I've got three
> characters, each on a different server:

It's a lot easier after your first one, especially if you
decide to twink. You can twink, you know what to fight, you
have powerful friends, and if you have two computers and two
accounts you have another high level character that's 100%
dedicated to helping your new character. A friend of mine
with two accounts has a L49 druid, and managed to powergame a
necro from level 1 to 40 in I'd guess about a week of played
time.

> Pendor, 12 Level Paladin (4 days, played, my first character ever)
> Windsinger Legendmaker, 24th Level Bard (22 days Played, favorite)
> Nona, 7th lvl enchanter (6 hours played, this weekend...grin)
>
> I thought this much time played (678 hours) meant I was a complete addict!

You only have about 32 days played out of the ~300 days the
game has been running. So you're only playing about 2-3 hours
a day, which means you probably have a life. :) Most of the
addicts are 4+ hour a day players. The college students,
work-at-home types, and sleep-deprived typically have 8+ hours
a day.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
